definitions.definition: A general type.
Manner; form of being or acting.
Condition above the vulgar; rank.
A person evaluated in a certain way (bad, good, strange, etc.).
Group, company.
A good-looking woman.
An act of sorting.
definitions.example: I had a sort of my cupboard.

definitions.definition: An algorithm for sorting a list of items into a particular sequence.
definitions.example: Popular algorithms for sorts include quicksort and heapsort.

definitions.definition: A piece of metal type used to print one letter, character, or symbol in a particular size and style.
A type.
Chance; lot; destiny.
A full set of anything, such as a pair of shoes, or a suit of clothes.
To separate items into different categories according to certain criteria that determine their sorts.
definitions.example: Sort the letters in those bags into a separate pile for each language.

definitions.definition: To arrange into some sequence, usually numerically, alphabetically or chronologically.
definitions.example: Sort those bells into a row in ascending sequence of pitch.

definitions.definition: To conjoin; to put together in distribution; to class.
To conform; to adapt; to accommodate.
To choose from a number; to select; to cull.
To join or associate with others, especially with others of the same kind or species; to agree.
To suit; to fit; to be in accord; to harmonize.
To fix (a problem) or handle (a task).
To attack physically.
definitions.example: If he comes nosing around here again I'll sort him!
